title: AI Moat Erosion
context: Companies raise billions to build proprietary AI models, claiming their model is their moat. But the AI landscape commoditizes faster than any technology in history. Open-source models close the gap within months. Fine-tuning makes generic models competitive with specialized ones. The cost of training drops exponentially. What was a $100M advantage in January is a commodity by December. The moat isn't the model — it never was.
hypothesis: A proprietary AI model is a durable competitive advantage.

chain.root: Build competitive strategy around proprietary AI model

effects.label: Open-source models close the capability gap rapidly
effects.impact: 6-12 month lag between frontier and open-source

children.label: Meta releases competitive models for free
Fine-tuned open models match proprietary ones on specific tasks
Community improvements compound faster than any single company can innovate

effects.label: Training costs collapse — barrier to entry drops

children.label: Startups can train competitive models on modest budgets
Algorithmic improvements reduce compute requirements faster than hardware improves

effects.label: Differentiation shifts from model to data and distribution
effects.impact: Model quality converges, product quality diverges

children.label: Proprietary data becomes the real moat
User experience and workflow integration matter more than raw model capability
Companies that bet only on model quality find themselves commoditized

effects.label: Massive capital invested in depreciating assets
effects.impact: Billions in training compute with 12-month useful life

children.label: Investors realize AI model capex depreciates like hardware, not software
Companies that raised on model moat thesis face valuation compression

impact.metric: Value of proprietary data vs model

dontIf: Your entire competitive strategy depends on model capability alone
You're spending more on model training than on product and data moats
ifYouMust: Build moats around proprietary data, not proprietary models
Invest in user experience and workflow integration that creates switching costs
Design for model-agnostic architecture — swap models as better ones emerge
Focus on fine-tuning and domain specialization rather than general capability

alternatives.name: Data moat strategy
alternatives.note: Collect proprietary data through product usage that improves with scale

alternatives.name: Distribution moat
alternatives.note: Win on go-to-market, integrations, and ecosystem — not raw AI capability

alternatives.name: Model-agnostic platform
alternatives.note: Build the orchestration layer that works with any model — the picks-and-shovels play

sources.title: a16z: Who Owns the Generative AI Platform?
sources.note: Analysis showing value accruing to applications and data layers, not model providers

sources.title: Epoch AI: Trends in Machine Learning Compute
sources.note: Training costs declining 10x every 18 months through algorithmic and hardware improvements

sources.title: Hugging Face Open LLM Leaderboard
sources.note: Open-source models consistently closing gap with proprietary models within months of release

sources.title: Sequoia Capital: AI's $600B Question
sources.note: Analysis of the gap between AI infrastructure spending and actual revenue generation

falsifiability: Proprietary AI models maintain a 2+ year capability lead over open-source alternatives through 2028
Companies whose primary moat is their AI model sustain premium valuations for 5+ years
Training costs stabilize rather than continuing to decline exponentially

seo.description: Proprietary AI models depreciate in 6-18 months as open-source closes the gap. Training costs dropped 95% in 5 years. The moat is data and distribution, not the model.
keywords: ai moat erosion second order effects
